snippet: A report says that French peacekeepers in Bangui, the capital of the Central African Republic, had lured young boys into sex in return for food and sometimes money.
abstract: United Nations human rights investigator Gallianne Palayret says it was May 2014 when she informed French peacekeepers's commanding officer and unit’s legal affairs officer about child sexual abuse in Central African Republic, two months before France’s defense ministry claims it heard allegations; her account raises questions about how and when officials learned about accusations.
lead_paragraph: A report says that French peacekeepers in Bangui, the capital of the Central African Republic, had lured young boys into sex in return for food and sometimes money.

headline.main: U.N. Official Says French Learned Early of Abuse
headline.print_headline: U.N. Official Says French Learned Early of Abuse

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
